name: ARView.RenderOptions
desc: The available rendering options that you use to selectively disable certain rendering effects.

items.name: static let disableCameraGrain: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable the image noise effect.

items.name: static let disableHDR: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable the high dynamic range post-processing effect.

items.name: static let disableGroundingShadows: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable rendering of ambient occlusion and shadows that ground objects in an AR scene.

items.name: static let disableMotionBlur: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable the motion blur for all virtual content.

items.name: static let disableDepthOfField: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable the depth of field effect for all virtual content.

items.name: static let disablePersonOcclusion: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable person segmentation.

items.name: static let disableAREnvironmentLighting: ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Disable lighting from environment probes.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates an empty option set.

items.name: init<S>(S)
items.desc: Creates a new set from a finite sequence of items.

items.name: init(arrayLiteral: ARView.RenderOptions...)
items.desc: Creates a set containing the elements of the given array literal.

items.name: var isEmpty: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no elements.

items.name: func contains(ARView.RenderOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given element is a member of the option set.

items.name: func insert(ARView.RenderOptions) -> (inserted: Bool, memberAfterInsert: ARView.RenderOptions)
items.desc: Adds the given element to the option set if it is not already a member.

items.name: func update(with: ARView.RenderOptions) -> ARView.RenderOptions?
items.desc: Inserts the given element into the set.

items.name: func remove(ARView.RenderOptions) -> ARView.RenderOptions?
items.desc: Removes the given element and all elements subsumed by it.

items.name: func subtract(ARView.RenderOptions)
items.desc: Removes the elements of the given set from this set.

items.name: func subtracting(ARView.RenderOptions) -> ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Returns a new set containing the elements of this set that do not occur in the given set.

items.name: func union(ARView.RenderOptions) -> ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Returns a new option set of the elements contained in this set, in the given set, or in both.

items.name: func formUnion(ARView.RenderOptions)
items.desc: Inserts the elements of another set into this option set.

items.name: func intersection(ARView.RenderOptions) -> ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Returns a new option set with only the elements contained in both this set and the given set.

items.name: func formIntersection(ARView.RenderOptions)
items.desc: Removes all elements of this option set that are not also present in the given set.

items.name: func symmetricDifference(ARView.RenderOptions) -> ARView.RenderOptions
items.desc: Returns a new option set with the elements contained in this set or in the given set, but not in both.

items.name: func formSymmetricDifference(ARView.RenderOptions)
items.desc: Replaces this set with a new set containing all elements contained in either this set or the given set, but not in both.

items.name: func isSubset(of: ARView.RenderOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a subset of another set.

items.name: func isStrictSubset(of: ARView.RenderOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict subset of the given set.

items.name: func isSuperset(of: ARView.RenderOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a superset of the given set.

items.name: func isStrictSuperset(of: ARView.RenderOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict superset of the given set.

items.name: func isDisjoint(with: ARView.RenderOptions) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no members in common with the given set.
